diff_analysis.evidence: In lib/carrierwave/processing/rmagick.rb, create_info_block was changed from using img.public_send(:"#{k}=", v) over a provided options hash to building a string of Ruby code (assignments = options.map { |k, v| "self.#{k} = #{v}" }; code = "lambda { |img| " + assignments.join(";") + "}" ) and executing it with eval. If any part of options (keys or values) is influenced by user input, this allows arbitrary Ruby code execution, constituting a code injection (CWE-94).
